qas.question: What Empire brought horses to the Americas?
How long had horses been extinct in the Americas prior to their re-introduction?
What kind of impact did the re-emergence of horses have on some Native American cultures?
What did some tribes achieve by domesticating horses?
What enabled some tribes to expand territory, increase trade and capture more game?

context: The <a0_0>Spanish<a0_0/> Empire and other Europeans brought horses to the Americas. Some of these animals escaped and began to breed and increase their numbers in the wild. The re-introduction of the horse, extinct in the Americas for over <a1_0>7500 years<a1_0/>, had a <a2_0>profound<a2_0/> impact on Native American culture in the Great Plains of North America and of Patagonia in South America. By domesticating horses, some tribes had <a3_0>great success<a3_0/>: <a4_0>horses<a4_0/> enabled them to expand their territories, exchange more goods with neighboring tribes, and more easily capture game, especially bison.
